alert.note: Alert for Archer; Clay; Wichita (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 9:40PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Comanche, Cotton, southeastern Tillman, western Clay, Archer and Wichita Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 940 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Lawton to 3 miles south of Burkburnett to 7 miles south of Archer City. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Lawton, Burkburnett, Walters, Archer City, Iowa Park, Holliday, Geronimo, Grandfield, Temple, Petrolia, Scotland, Dean, Chattanooga, Randlett, Windthorst, Megargel, Jolly, Devol, and Faxon. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Severe weather is not expected and no warnings are anticipated at this time. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
